fullText: The musical has all the right moves, even if the story sometimes feels formulaic. The performances are stellar, particularly the quintet of actors who embody the Temptations with remarkable vocal prowess and synchronized choreography.
dtliExcerpt: The musical has all the right moves, even if the story sometimes feels formulaic. The performances are stellar, particularly the quintet of actors who embody the Temptations with remarkable vocal prowess and synchronized choreography.
bwwExcerpt: How, you wonder, could all of this talent belonging to the ages have been nurtured in just one American city? Time and again, projection designer Peter Negrini flashes the name of that municipality across the back of the Imperial stage. From the evidence of the marvelous "Ain't Too Proud," the letters that spell "Detroit" can never be written big enough.
